'''Ivan Ricardo Neves Abreu Cavaleiro''' (born 18 October 1993) is a Portuguese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for English club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]. Mainly a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]], he can also play as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]].
A product of [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]]'s youth system, he was part of the club's domestic [[Treble (association football)|treble]] in the [[2013–14 S.L. Benfica season|2013–14 season]].
Cavaleiro earned 63 [[Cap (sport)|caps]] for [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] at youth level all categories comprised, scoring 13 goals. He made his senior international debut in 2014.
==Club career==
===Benfica=== Born in [[Vila Franca de Xira]], [[Lisbon District]], Cavaleiro played youth football for five clubs, notably representing [[S.L. Benfica]] from ages 13–18, a loan spell notwithstanding. He made his senior debut in the [[2012–13 Segunda Liga|2012–13 season]], playing his first [[Segunda Liga]] match with [[S.L. Benfica B|the reserves]] on 11 August 2012 against [[S.C. Braga B]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/2--liga/detalhe/benfica-b-sp-braga-b-2-2-andre-gomes-da-empate-nos-descontos-772861.html|title=Benfica B-Sp. Braga B, 2–2: André Gomes dá empate nos descontos|trans-title=Benfica B-Sp. Braga B, 2–2: André Gomes for the draw in injury time|newspaper=[[Record (newspaper)|Record]]|language=pt|date=11 August 2012|accessdate=1 June 2017}}</ref> The following weekend he scored his first goal(s) as a professional, grabbing a brace in a 4–2 away win over [[C.D. Feirense]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/2--liga/detalhe/feirense-benfica-b-2-4-aguias-goleiam-com-bis-de-ivan-cavaleiro-774052.html|title=Feirense-Benfica B, 2–4: Águias goleiam com bis de Ivan Cavaleiro|trans-title=Feirense-Benfica B, 2–4: Eagles rout with Ivan Cavaleiro brace|newspaper=Record|language=pt|date=19 August 2012|accessdate=1 June 2017}}</ref> and added another two before the end of the month, in a 6–0 home routing of [[C.F. Os Belenenses]];<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/2--liga/detalhe/benfica-b-belenenses-goleada-na-luz-6-0-775375.html|title=Benfica B-Belenenses: Goleada na Luz (6–0)|trans-title=Benfica B-Belenenses: Routing at the Luz (6–0)|newspaper=Record|language=pt|date=27 August 2012|accessdate=1 June 2017}}</ref> he finished his first year with 38 appearances and 12 goals, helping his team to the seventh position.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/liga-nos/benfica/detalhe/esforco-de-cavaleiro-ja-teve-a-recompensa-847981|title=Esforço de Cavaleiro já teve a recompensa|trans-title=Cavaleiro's effort has already paid off|newspaper=Record|language=pt|date=19 October 2013|accessdate=7 October 2018}}</ref>
Cavaleiro started [[2013–14 Segunda Liga|his second season]] with Benfica B in fashion, netting seven times in ten matches and earning the ''Second Division Player of the Month'' award for August/September.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.ojogo.pt/futebol/1a-liga/benfica/noticias/interior/ivan-cavaleiro-foi-o-melhor-da-ii-liga-3480429.html|title=Ivan Cavaleiro foi o melhor da II Liga|trans-title=Ivan Cavaleiro was the best in II League|newspaper=[[O Jogo]]|language=pt|date=16 October 2013|accessdate=19 October 2013}}</ref> He made his official debut for the main squad on 19 October 2013, playing the full 90 minutes against CD Cinfães for the [[Taça de Portugal]] and [[Assist (football)|assisting]] [[Ola John]] for [[2013–14 Taça de Portugal|the game]]'s only goal;<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.jn.pt/desporto/interior/benfica-venceu-por-10-em-cinfaes-3486287.html|title=Benfica venceu por 1–0 em Cinfães|trans-title=Benfica won 1–0 in Cinfães|newspaper=[[Jornal de Notícias]]|language=pt|date=19 October 2013|accessdate=1 June 2017}}</ref> only four days later, he appeared in his maiden match in the [[UEFA Champions League]], playing the second half of a 1–1 home draw against [[Olympiacos F.C.]] for [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|the group stage]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000479/match=2011796/postmatch/report/index.html#cardozo+benficas+saviour|title=Cardozo the saviour as Benfica hold Olympiacos|publisher=UEFA|date=23 October 2013|accessdate=24 October 2013}}</ref>
On 15 January 2014, Cavaleiro scored his first competitive goal for Benfica, netting the last in a 2–0 win against [[Leixões S.C.]] for [[2013–14 Taça da Liga|the campaign]]'s [[Taça da Liga]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Nacional/1a_liga/Benfica//interior_premium.aspx?content_id=863084|title=Cavaleiro já fatura entre os "grandes"|trans-title=Cavaleiro already bagging it among "big boys"|newspaper=Record|language=pt|date=16 January 2014|accessdate=17 January 2014}}</ref> On 7 August, he was loaned to [[Deportivo de La Coruña]] in the Spanish [[La Liga]] for one year,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.canaldeportivo.com/servlet/es.iris.servlets.Noticias?accion=4&ver=1&nid=28495&mid=12|title=Cavaleiro supera sin contratiempos los reconocimientos médicos y se incorpora al entrenamiento|trans-title=Cavaleiro overcomes medical smoothly and joins training|publisher=Deportivo La Coruña|language=es|date=8 August 2014|accessdate=8 August 2014}}</ref> making his debut on [[2014–15 La Liga|the first matchday]] and opening the scoring in a 1–2 defeat at [[Granada CF]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/primera/jornada_1/gda_dep/|title=El Granada ya muestra el oficio 'made in Caparrós'|trans-title=Granada already showing know-how 'made in Caparrós'|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|last=Liceras|first=Ángel|language=es|date=23 August 2014|accessdate=8 November 2014}}</ref>
===Monaco=== On 10 July 2015, Cavaleiro joined [[AS Monaco FC]] on a permanent deal until 2020,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slbenfica.pt/noticias/detalhedenoticia/tabid/2788/ArticleId/42342/language/pt-PT/.aspx|title=Ivan Cavaleiro no Mónaco até 2020|trans-title=Ivan Cavaleiro at Monaco until 2020|publisher=S.L. Benfica|language=pt|date=10 July 2015|access-date=10 July 2015}}</ref> for a transfer fee rumoured to be €15 million.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.abola.pt/clubes/ver.aspx?t=3&id=559297|title=Ivan Cavaleiro no Mónaco por 15 milhões de euros|trans-title=Ivan Cavaleiro to Monaco for 15 million euros|newspaper=[[A Bola]]|language=pt|date=10 July 2015|access-date=11 July 2015}}</ref> He made his debut on the 28th, starting in a 3–1 away win over [[BSC Young Boys]] in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round|third qualifying round]] of [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|the Champions League]], and scored his first goal in the second leg, opening a 4–0 victory at the [[Stade Louis II]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1716/champions-league/2015/08/04/14165312/champions-league-round-up-ajax-crash-out-and-monaco-cruise|title=Champions League round-up: Ajax crash out and Monaco cruise through|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|last=Creek|first=Stephen|date=4 August 2015|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref>
===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== On 31 August 2016, Cavaleiro moved to English [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on a five-year deal (with the option of an additional year) for an undisclosed fee, reported to be a new club-record sum of £7 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37236123|title=Ivan Cavaleiro: Wolves sign Monaco winger in record deal on five-year contract|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=31 August 2016|accessdate=31 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/wolves-sign-monacos-ivan-cavaleiro-11825300|title=Wolves sign Monaco's Ivan Cavaleiro for a club record £7 million fee|newspaper=[[Birmingham Mail]]|date=31 August 2016|accessdate=31 August 2016}}</ref> He made his debut on 10 September in a 1–1 home draw to [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37263310|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 1–1 Burton Albion|publisher=BBC Sport|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=10 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/wolves-vs-burton-alb/358181|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 1–1 Burton Albion|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=16 December 2016}}</ref> and scored his first goal for the club 14 days later in a 3–1 win against [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] also at [[Molineux Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37392408|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 3–1 Brentford|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 September 2016|accessdate=24 September 2016}}</ref>
Cavaleiro was voted the [[Professional Footballers' Association]] Fans' Championship Player of the Month for November 2017, after netting four times in as many games.<ref name=POTM>{{cite web|url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/news/first-team/20171206-cavaleiro-the-pfa-player-of-the-month/|title=Cavaleiro the PFA Player Of The Month|publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C|date=6 December 2017|accessdate=18 December 2017}}</ref> The previous month, he had provided five assists to keep his team clear at the top of [[2017–18 EFL Championship|the table]];<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2017/10/19/the-stats-behind-wolves-flying-start-to-the-season/|title=The stats behind Wolves' flying start to the season|newspaper=[[Express & Star]]|date=19 October 2017|accessdate=18 December 2017}}</ref> he finished the season with nine goals from 42 appearances (adding 12 decisive passes), and achieved promotion to the [[Premier League]] as champion.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/how-much-wolves-star-ivan-14799537|title=How much Wolves star Ivan Cavaleiro is worth as Huddersfield Town fee speculation swirls|newspaper=[[Birmingham Mail]]|last=Kendrick|first=Mat|date=18 June 2018|accessdate=29 September 2018}}</ref>
Cavaleiro's first match in the [[English football league system|English top division]] occurred on 29 September 2018, and he scored once in the 2–0 home victory over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] with his very first touch of the ball after coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in place of compatriot [[Diogo Jota]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45610318|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 2–0 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Poole|first=Harry|date=29 September 2018|accessdate=29 September 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Ivan Cavaleiro (7).jpg|200px|thumbnail|right|Cavaleiro playing for [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal U19]]]]
===Youth=== Cavaleiro was named in the [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal under-19 squad]] at the [[2012 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2012 UEFA European Championship]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rtp.pt/noticias/selecao-nacional/sub-19-convocados-para-europeu_d561608|title=Sub-19 – Convocados para Europeu|trans-title=Under-19 – European selection|publisher=[[Rádio e Televisão de Portugal]]|language=pt|date=11 June 2012|accessdate=12 February 2018}}</ref> playing the last match of the group stage against [[Greece national under-19 football team|Greece]]. A year later, he represented [[Portugal national under-20 football team|the under-20 team]] at the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]]: he appeared in four games as a substitute in [[Turkey]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/matches/round=259235/match=300232802/summary.html|title=Bruma brace denies Nigeria|publisher=FIFA|date=21 June 2013|accessdate=16 October 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/matches/round=259235/match=300232843/summary.html|title=Korea come from behind, hold Portugal|publisher=FIFA|date=24 June 2013|accessdate=16 October 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/matches/round=259235/match=300232830/summary.html|title=Five-star Portugal cruise through|publisher=FIFA|date=27 June 2013|accessdate=16 October 2013}}</ref> in an eventual [[Single-elimination tournament|round-of-16]] exit.
Cavaleiro made his debut for [[Portugal national under-21 football team|the under-21s]] on 14 August 2013, netting a [[hat-trick]] in a 5–2 [[Exhibition game|friendly]] win against [[Switzerland national under-21 football team|Switzerland]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/seleccao/portugal-suica-sub-21-golos-cronica/1480060-1194.html|title=Sub-21: Portugal–Suíça, 5–2 (crónica)|trans-title=Under-21: Portugal–Switzerland, 5–2 (match report)|publisher=Mais Futebol|language=pt|date=14 August 2013|accessdate=16 October 2013}}</ref> On 27 June 2015, he scored Portugal's third goal in a 5–0 win against [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]] in the semi-finals of the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|European Championship]] in Czech Republic;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/matches/round=2000409/match=2015382/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Five-goal Portugal stun Germany in semi-finals|publisher=UEFA|last=Hart|first=Simon|date=27 June 2015|access-date=27 June 2015}}</ref> he was named in the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship#Team of the tournament|Team of the Tournament]], in an eventual runner-up finish.<ref name="Team">{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/news/newsid=2262826.html|title=The official Under-21 Team of the Tournament|publisher=UEFA|date=1 July 2015|access-date=2 July 2015}}</ref>
===Senior=== On 28 February 2014, Cavaleiro received his first callup for the [[Portugal national football team|Portugal senior side]], for an exhibition game with [[Cameroon national football team|Cameroon]] on 5 March,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.publico.pt/desporto/noticia/rafa-e-ivan-cavaleiro-convocados-para-jogo-da-seleccao-com-os-camaroes-1626576|title=Rafa e Ivan Cavaleiro convocados para jogo da selecção com os Camarões|trans-title=Rafa and Ivan Cavaleiro called for national team game with Cameroon|newspaper=[[Público (Portugal)|Público]]|language=pt|date=28 February 2014|accessdate=2 March 2014}}</ref> starting and playing 70 minutes in the 5–1 win in [[Leiria]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/friendlies/season=2014/matches/round=2000374/match=2013713/postmatch/report/index.html#new+ronaldo+milestone|title=Ronaldo reaches new milestone in Portugal win|publisher=UEFA|date=5 March 2014|accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref>
==Personal life== Cavaleiro's father, Lindo, was crowned Angolan youth champion for [[Atlético Petróleos de Luanda]], whilst his uncle Monhé excelled as a [[midfielder]] for [[Progresso Associação do Sambizanga]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.cmjornal.pt/desporto/detalhe/jorge-jesus-chama-ivan-cavaleiro|title=Jorge Jesus chama Ivan Cavaleiro|trans-title=Jorge Jesus calls Ivan Cavaleiro|newspaper=[[Correio da Manhã]]|language=pt|date=14 October 2013|accessdate=21 June 2017}}</ref>

Benfica|Benfica]], and [[EFL Cup]] & [[FA Cup]] with [[Wolverhampton Wanderers|Wolves]]. :B. {{note|B}} Includes appearances in the [[UEFA Champions League]] and [[UEFA Europa League]]. :C. {{note|C}} Includes appearances in the [[Taça da Liga]] and [[Coupe de la Ligue]]. {{refend}}
==Honours== '''Benfica''' *[[Primeira Liga]]: [[2013–14 Primeira Liga|2013–14]] *[[Taça de Portugal]]: [[2013–14 Taça de Portugal|2013–14]] *[[Taça da Liga]]: [[2013–14 Taça da Liga|2013–14]] *[[UEFA Europa League]] runner-up: [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League|2013–14]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000474/match=2012680/postmatch/report/index.html#spot+sevilla+leave+benfica+dreams+tatters|title=Spot-on Sevilla leave Benfica dreams in tatters|publisher=UEFA|date=14 May 2014|accessdate=15 May 2014}}</ref>
'''Wolverhampton Wanderers''' *[[EFL Championship]]: [[2017–18 EFL Championship|2017–18]]<ref>{{cite book|editor-first=John|editor-last=Anderson|title=Football Yearbook 2018–2019|year=2018|publisher=Headline Publishing Group|location=London|isbn=978-1-4722-6106-9|pages=386–387}}</ref>
'''Portugal U21''' *[[UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] runner-up: [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2015]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/matches/round=2000411/match=2015383/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Spot-on Sweden beat Portugal to win U21 EURO|publisher=UEFA|last=Kell|first=Tom|date=30 June 2015|accessdate=1 October 2018}}</ref>
'''Individual''' *[[SJPF Segunda Liga Player of the Month]]: August 2013, September 2013 *UEFA European Under-21 Championship Team of the tournament: [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship#Team of the tournament|2015]]<ref name="Team"/> *[[Professional Footballers' Association]] Fans' Championship Player of the Month: November 2017<ref name=POTM/>

{{Medal|Team|{{fb|Portugal}}}} {{Medal|RU|[[UEFA European Under-21 Championship|UEFA U-21 Championship]]|[[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2015]]}} }} '''Rúben Diogo da Silva Neves''' ({{IPA-pt|ˈnɛvɨʃ|lang}}; born 13 March 1997) is a Portuguese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] and the [[Portugal national football team|Portugal national team]].
==Club career== ===Porto=== Born in [[Mozelos (Santa Maria da Feira)]], [[Aveiro District]], Neves grew up supporting [[FC Porto]] and joined the club's youth system at the age of 8.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/sep/21/ruben-neves-diogo-jota-wolves-porto-cricket-interview|title=Wolves’ Rúben Neves and Diogo Jota: ‘Porto has wine, food but here it’s fine’|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|first=Stuart|last=James|date=21 September 2018|accessdate=5 November 2018}}</ref><ref name=PortuGoal>{{cite web|url=https://portugoal.net/on-the-rise/356-profile-of-porto-prodigy-ruben-neves|title=Profile of Porto prodigy Rúben Neves|publisher=PortuGOAL|date=24 December 2015|accessdate=5 November 2018}}</ref> During his time with the academy, he also spent a season on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] at [[Padroense F.C.|Padroense]] which acted as the under-16 side;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2132818.html|title=The rapid rise of Rúben Neves|publisher=UEFA|last=Pimentel|first=José Nuno|accessdate=20 August 2014|date=17 August 2014}}</ref> on his time in the youth structures, [[FC Porto B|reserve team]] manager [[Luís Castro (Portuguese footballer)|Luís Castro]] described him as a player with "extraordinary mental qualities, to go along with technical and tactical skills".<ref name=PortuGoal/>
Ahead of the [[2014–15 Primeira Liga|2014–15 campaign]], Neves was earmarked to bypass Porto's under-19s and play with the reserves instead. Following an injury to teammate [[Mikel Agu]], however, he was called by [[Julen Lopetegui]] to be part of the main squad's pre-season preparations.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.ojogo.pt/futebol/1a-liga/porto/noticias/interior/ruben-neves-tem-um-talento-mental-extraordinario-4070889.html|title=Rúben Neves tem um talento mental extraordinário|trans-title=Rúben Neves has an extraordinary mental talent|newspaper=[[O Jogo]]|language=pt|date=8 August 2014|accessdate=21 August 2014}}</ref> On 15 August 2014, aged 17 years and five months, he made his [[Primeira Liga]] debut where he started and scored in a 2–0 home win against [[C.S. Marítimo|Marítimo]] – in doing so, he became the youngest player in the club's history to score a goal in the competition.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/liga-fc-porto-maritimo-cronica/53ee72880cf2c1dfdf15bb68.html|title=FC Porto-Marítimo, 2–0 (crónica)|trans-title=FC Porto-Marítimo, 2–0 (report)|publisher=Mais Futebol|last=Almeida|first=Germano|language=pt|date=15 August 2014|accessdate=18 August 2014}}</ref> He played his first match in the [[UEFA Champions League]] five days later in a 1–0 win over [[Lille OSC|Lille]], and broke another record (previously held by [[Cristiano Ronaldo]]) by being the youngest Portuguese to appear in the tournament.<ref name=PortuGoal/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/liga-campeoes-fc-porto-ruben-neves-cristiano-ronaldo-lille-play-off/53f4eee90cf2103fd4482b11.html|title=Rúben Neves o português mais novo de sempre a jogar na ''Champions''|trans-title=Rúben Neves the youngest Portuguese ever to play in the Champions|publisher=Mais Futebol|language=pt|date=20 August 2014|accessdate=21 August 2014}}</ref>
On 10 December 2014, during a [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|Champions League group stage]] fixture against [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]], Neves suffered an injury to his right knee following a collision in midfield with [[Alex Teixeira]]. At the end of the game, the club explained that he suffered a sprain, with apparent damage to the internal lateral ligament.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.ojogo.pt/futebol/1a-liga/porto/noticias/interior/ruben-neves-com-lesao-no-joelho-direito-4288722.html|title=Rúben Neves com lesão no joelho direito|trans-title=Rúben Neves with right knee injury|newspaper=O Jogo|language=pt|date=10 December 2014|accessdate=4 January 2015}}</ref> After spending nearly a month on the sidelines, he returned to the pitch in a [[2014–15 Taça da Liga|3–1 home win]] over [[C.F. União|União da Madeira]] in the [[Taça da Liga]];<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/liga-nos/fc-porto/detalhe/ruben-neves-regressa-aos-convocados-924835.html|title=Rúben Neves regressa aos convocados|trans-title=Rúben Neves returns to squad|newspaper=[[Record (newspaper)|Record]]|language=pt|date=12 January 2015|accessdate=23 March 2016}}</ref> following his injury, his role in midfield was filled by [[Casemiro]] and he spent the majority of the remainder of the season behind the Brazilian in the pecking order.<ref name=PortuGoal/>
On 20 October 2015, aged 18 years and 221 days, Neves became the youngest player to start as [[Captain (association football)|captain]] in the Champions League, helping Porto to a 2–0 win against [[Maccabi Tel Aviv F.C.|Maccabi Tel Aviv]] in [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|the group phase]] and surpassing previous record holder [[Rafael van der Vaart]], who held it since 16 September 2003.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2296033.html|title=Porto's Rúben Neves, Iker Casillas make history|publisher=UEFA|date=20 October 2015|accessdate=21 October 2015}}</ref> On 5 December, in a 2–1 success over [[F.C. Paços de Ferreira|Paços de Ferreira]] also at the [[Estádio do Dragão]], he broke another record by becoming the youngest player to achieve 50 games for the club, surpassing players like [[Fernando Gomes (footballer)|Fernando Gomes]] and [[Jaime Magalhães]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.ojogo.pt/futebol/1a-liga/porto/noticias/interior/ruben-neves-e-o-mais-jovem-a-completar-50-jogos-4917762.html|title=Rúben Neves é o mais jovem a completar 50 jogos|trans-title=Rúben Neves is the youngest to complete 50 games|newspaper=O Jogo|language=pt|date=6 December 2015|accessdate=6 December 2015}}</ref>
Neves scored his second competitive goal on 3 February 2016, opening the scoreline in a 3–0 triumph at [[Gil Vicente F.C.|Gil Vicente]] for [[2015–16 Taça de Portugal|the semi-finals]] of the [[Taça de Portugal]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.ojogo.pt/futebol/1a-liga/porto/noticias/interior/nunca-e-facil-mudar-de-estrategia-5014013.html|title=Nunca é fácil mudar de estratégia|trans-title="It is never easy to change strategy"|newspaper=O Jogo|language=pt|date=3 February 2016|accessdate=4 February 2016}}</ref>
===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== On 8 July 2017, [[EFL Championship]] side [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] announced that they had signed Neves for an undisclosed fee, thought to be in the region of £15.8 million – a club and league record fee.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/news/first-team/20170708-neves-arrives/|title=Neves arrives!|publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C|date=8 July 2017|accessdate=8 July 2017}}</ref> Upon joining, he was reunited with former Porto manager [[Nuno Espírito Santo]].<ref name=Fifty>{{cite web|url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/news/first-team/20181010-50-games-of-neves-a-look-back/|title=50 games of Neves: A look back|publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C|date=10 October 2018|accessdate=5 November 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal on 15 August, in a 3–2 away win over [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40858331|title=Hull City 2–3 Wolverhampton Wanderers|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=15 August 2017|accessdate=16 August 2017}}</ref>
In April 2018, Neves was nominated for the EFL Championship Player of the Season and Young Player of the Season awards, and was also included in the Team of the Season along with teammates [[Conor Coady]] and [[John Ruddy]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43641225|title=EFL awards: Tom Cairney, Ruben Neves & Ryan Sessgenon on Championship shortlist|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 April 2018|accessdate=4 April 2018}}</ref> His team was ultimately [[2017–18 EFL Championship|promoted as champions]] with the player scoring six goals in 42 appearances, all of which were scored from outside of the box;<ref name=PR>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/everton-wolves-richarlison-ruben-neves-goals-report-a8488566.html|title=Richarlison and Ruben Neves ready to lead by example for Everton and Wolves|newspaper=[[The Independent]]|last=Nash|first=Tim|date=13 August 2018|accessdate=15 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/693584|title=FPL promotion prospects: The Wolves worth hunting|publisher=[[Premier League]]|date=27 May 2018|accessdate=14 August 2018}}</ref> at the conclusion of the campaign, he claimed a hat-trick of club awards as he walked away with the Player of the Season, Player's Player of the Season and Goal of the Season accolades.<ref name=Fifty/>
Wolves announced that Neves had signed a new contract in July 2018, extending until 2023.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44689010|title=Ruben Neves: Wolves midfielder signs new five-year deal|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 July 2018|accessdate=25 July 2018}}</ref> In the first match of [[2018–19 Premier League|the new season]], he scored his first [[Premier League]] goal and assisted [[Raúl Jiménez]] in the latter's competitive debut, as his team twice came from behind to draw 2–2 against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/aug/11/wolves-everton-premier-league-match-report|title=Wolves’ Raúl Jiménez pegs back 10-man Everton after Richarlison's double|newspaper=The Guardian|last=Aarons|first=Ed|date=11 August 2018|accessdate=13 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/sg/news/wolves-2-everton-2-jimenez-header-ensures-richarlisons-brace-vain|title=Wolves 2 Everton 2: Jimenez header ensures Richarlison's brace in vain|publisher=[[FourFourTwo]]|date=11 August 2018|accessdate=11 August 2018}}</ref> His appearance in the match, alongside compatriots [[Rui Patrício]], [[João Moutinho]], [[Diogo Jota]] and [[Hélder Costa (footballer)|Hélder Costa]] also saw the club break the league record for the most Portuguese players named in a starting line-up.<ref name=PR/>
On 6 October 2018, Neves made his 50th appearance for Wolverhampton and marked the occasion by contributing in the build-up for [[Matt Doherty (footballer, born 1992)|Matt Doherty]]'s winning goal in a 1–0 victory over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref name=Fifty/> The following January, his 55th-minute winning goal against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] at [[Molineux Stadium|Molineux]] in the [[FA Cup]], "a venomous dipping shot from {{convert|31|yards|m|abbr=out}} that beat [[Simon Mignolet]] at his near post",<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46718633|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 2–1 Liverpool|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Chowdhury|first=Saj|date=7 January 2019|accessdate=7 January 2019}}</ref> was voted the best of [[2018–19 FA Cup#Third Round Proper|the third round]] by visitors to [[BBC Sport]]'s website.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46788650|title=FA Cup: Wolves midfielder Ruben Neves wins goal of the FA Cup third round|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 January 2019|accessdate=9 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Ruben Neves avec la selection.jpg|thumb|upright|Neves playing for [[Portugal national under-17 football team|Portugal U17]] in 2014]]Neves represented [[Portugal national under-17 football team|Portugal]] at the [[2014 UEFA European Under-17 Championship]], helping the country reach the semi-finals as [[Captain (association football)|team captain]]. For his performances, he was named among the top ten talents of the tournament by a selection of [[UEFA]] reporters.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/news/newsid=2106764.html|title=Ten under-17 players to keep an eye on|publisher=UEFA|date=22 May 2014|accessdate=18 August 2014}}</ref>
On 29 August 2014, still aged 17, Neves was called by coach [[Rui Jorge]] to be part of the [[Portugal national under-21 football team|under-21 side]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://desporto.sapo.pt/futebol/seleccao/euro_sub_21/artigo/2014/08/29/portugal-sub-21-sporting-domina-convocat-ria-ruben-neves-chamado|title=Sporting domina convocatória, Ruben Neves chamado|trans-title=Sporting dominate list, Ruben Neves called|publisher=[[SAPO (company)|SAPO]]|language=pt|date=29 August 2014|accessdate=18 September 2014}}</ref> He scored his first goal on 14 October, helping to a 5–4 home win against the [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands]] for [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification|the playoff round]] of the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/matches/round=2000413/match=2015238/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Portugal through after nine-goal thriller|publisher=UEFA|date=14 October 2014|accessdate=24 February 2015}}</ref>
When the finals began in the Czech Republic, Neves broke a new record by becoming the youngest player to debut for the Portuguese under-21s in the tournament, aged 18 years and three months, playing five minutes to help beat [[England national under-21 football team|England]] 1–0 in the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship#Group B|group stage]] opener.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://desporto.sapo.pt/futebol/seleccao/portugal/artigo/2015/06/19/ruben-neves-quebra-recorde-mas-quer-mais-nao-posso-abrandar|title=Rúben Neves quebra recorde mas quer mais: "Não posso abrandar"|trans-title=Ruben Neves breaks record but wants more: "I can't slow down"|publisher=SAPO|language=pt|date=19 June 2015|accessdate=3 July 2015}}</ref> It was his only appearance, as the country reached [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship Final|the final]] and lost it to [[Sweden national under-21 football team|Sweden]] in a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]].<ref name=UEFA>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/matches/round=2000411/match=2015383/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Spot-on Sweden beat Portugal to win U21 EURO|publisher=UEFA|last=Kell|first=Tom|date=30 June 2015|accessdate=3 September 2015}}</ref>
Neves was first called up to [[Portugal national football team|the senior squad]] on 10 November 2015, ahead of [[Exhibition game|friendlies]] against [[Russia national football team|Russia]] and [[Luxembourg national football team|Luxembourg]] as an injury replacement for [[João Moutinho]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/618334/Liverpool-Chelsea-Ruben-Neves-Porto-international-debut-Portugal|title=Liverpool and Chelsea target in high demand as youngster set to make international debut|newspaper=[[Daily Express]]|last=Gray|first=James|date=10 November 2015|accessdate=13 November 2015}}</ref> He made his debut in the former match, featuring 17 minutes in the 0–1 loss in [[Krasnodar]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pt.uefa.com/uefaeuro/qualifiers/news/newsid=2304930.html|title=Rússia vence Portugal em Krasnodar|trans-title=Russia beat Portugal in Krasnodar|publisher=UEFA|language=pt|date=14 November 2015|accessdate=17 November 2015}}</ref> then played the entire 2–0 win against the latter at the [[Stade Josy Barthel]], sharing the midfield area with Porto teammates [[Danilo Pereira (Portuguese footballer)|Danilo Pereira]] and [[André André]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/selecao/andre-andre/luxemburgo-portugal-2-0-cronica|title=Luxemburgo-Portugal, 0–2 (crónica)|trans-title=Luxembourg-Portugal, 0–2 (report)|publisher=Mais Futebol|language=pt|date=17 November 2015|accessdate=18 November 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.ojogo.pt/internacional/selecao/noticias/interior/aproveitamos-o-meiocampo-do-fc-porto-4889964.html|title=Aproveitamos o meio-campo do FC Porto|trans-title=We took advantage of the FC Porto midfield|newspaper=O Jogo|language=pt|date=17 November 2015|accessdate=18 November 2015}}</ref>
Neves was selected by full side manager [[Fernando Santos (Portuguese footballer)|Fernando Santos]] to a preliminary 35-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/revealed-every-world-cup-2018-squad-23-man-preliminary-lists/oa0atsduflsv1nsf6oqk576rb|title=Revealed: Every World Cup 2018 squad – 23-man & preliminary lists & when will they be announced?|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|date=17 May 2018|accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref> but he did not make the final cut.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sbs.com.au/news/portugal-world-cup-squad|title=Nearly half Portugal's Euro squad to miss World Cup|publisher=[[Special Broadcasting Service]]|date=17 May 2018|accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref>
==Style of play== An article on [[UEFA|UEFA.com]] described Neves as a [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|defensive midfielder]] who is not afraid to go forward and prompt attacks, showing great maturity combined with an accurate passing skill, great vision and an astute sense of positioning. His playing attributes also granted him comparisons to Portuguese international teammate Moutinho for his fine first touch, similar desire to press his opponents and excellent distribution.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=por/news/newsid=2241045.html|title=UEFA.com's weekly wonderkid: Rúben Neves|publisher=UEFA|date=2 May 2015|accessdate=5 May 2015}}</ref>
Neves also drew praise in the media for his technical, tactical and mental qualities,<ref name=PortuGoal/> as well as his intelligence and shooting ability.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.calciomercato.com/en/news/the-portuguese-star-who-broke-the-records-of-ronaldo-ready-to-jo-72883|title=The Portuguese star who broke the records of Ronaldo ready to join Juventus|publisher=Calcio Mercato|last=Laurenti|first=Mirko|date=23 November 2018|accessdate=25 November 2018}}</ref>

==Honours== '''Porto''' *[[Taça de Portugal]] runner-up: [[2015–16 Taça de Portugal|2015–16]]
'''Wolverhampton Wanderers''' *[[EFL Championship]]: [[2017–18 EFL Championship|2017–18]]<ref>{{cite book|editor-first=John|editor-last=Anderson|title=Football Yearbook 2018–2019|year=2018|publisher=Headline Publishing Group|location=London|isbn=978-1-4722-6106-9|pages=386–387}}</ref>
'''Portugal U21''' *[[UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] runner-up: [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2015]]<ref name=UEFA/>
'''Individual''' *[[UEFA European Under-17 Championship]] Team of the Tournament: [[2014 UEFA European Under-17 Championship#Team of the Tournament|2014]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/season=2014/technical-report/tr-under17-2014.pdf|title=Technical report|publisher=UEFA|pages=21–22|format=PDF|accessdate=10 November 2016}}</ref> *[[Confederação do Desporto de Portugal]] Young Prospect of the Year: 2015<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.ojogo.pt/futebol/1a-liga/porto/noticias/interior/ruben-neves-distinguido-como-jovem-promessa-do-ano-4881073.html|title=Rúben Neves distinguido como Jovem Promessa do Ano|trans-title=Rúben Neves distinguished as Young Prospect of the Year|newspaper=O Jogo|language=pt|date=11 November 2015|accessdate=11 November 2015}}</ref> *EFL Championship Team of the Season: 2017–18<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.efl.com/news/2018/april/efl-awards-2018-shortlists-revealed|title=EFL Awards 2018: Shortlists revealed|publisher=[[English Football League]]|date=3 April 2018|accessdate=3 April 2018}}</ref> *[[PFA Team of the Year]]: [[PFA Team of the Year (2010s)#Championship 9|2017–18 Championship]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43808543|title=PFA Championship Team of the Year: Wolves & Fulham trios named in line-up|publisher=BBC Sport|date=18 April 2018|accessdate=5 May 2018}}</ref>
